entry.title: The Long Watch
entry.summary:
Author: Allypop_84

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,553Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 25

Summary: After a catastrophic fire leaves Eddie injured, he wakes with no memory of Buck or their life together. As Buck stays by his side, navigating hospitals, home life, and the firehouse, he struggles to protect Eddie while slowly rekindling their bond, proving that love can survive even when memory does not.

entry.summary:
Author: Elgney

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 14,885Chapters: 2/3Kudos: 244

Summary: "Hey, sorry about that, I was justâ€”Eddie?â€ Eddieâ€™s head shot up at the sight of Buck, frozen halfway towards his seat. â€œBuck?â€ Buck let out an awkward chuckle and glanced around. â€œThere must be a mix-up, Iâ€™ll go askâ€”â€ â€œNo!â€ Eddie practically yelled the word, and then he winced at the desperation in his own voice. Belatedly, he realized it was possible that people who were interested in men were supposed to be sitting there. But Buck was watching him with wide eyes, still paused leaning on his chair, so Eddie added, â€œI could use a six-minute break. You know, from finding out how many siblings every woman in this bar has.â€ Buckâ€™s eyes glinted in the dim bar lighting. He finally took the seat and asked, â€œoh, so you donâ€™t care about how many siblings I have?â€ â€”â€” Eddie and Buck finally go on a date. It just takes them three times to realize it.

entry.title: scared of only ordinary shit
entry.summary:
Author: devilsbuckley

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 8,959Chapters: 4/10Kudos: 10

Summary: "Buck stared at the side of Eddie's face, illuminated only by the dashboard lights and the occasional passing streetlamp. It struck him then, with the force of a physical blow, that he had spent years mistaking Eddie's silence for peace, when it had actually been a cage. He reached out, his fingers hovering over the console, terrifyingly aware that the distance between their hands was small, but the distance between their realities was an ocean he didn't know how to swim." After a reckless call forces Buck to reevaluate everything he thought he knew about his best friend, he uncovers the deep-seated religious guilt Eddie has been hiding for decades and resolves to help him trade his existential terror for a life where the only things to fear for a life where the only things to fear are the ordinary, manageable tragedies of being human.

entry.title: Drop The Act!
entry.summary:
Author: Dark_Phantom248

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 23,124Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 42

Summary: â€œWho's your favorite character?â€ Buck asked, a smirk playing on his lips. Eddie sat there, thinking, for a moment before he said, â€œI think Tyler is my favorite. I mean, sure, he's hunting down Ollie and being really stupid, but the way his character has progressed since he was first shown on screen an hour ago, it just shows how much life can change people, and I relate to that.â€ Buck liked hearing that from Eddie because Buck had been the one to pitch the idea for his character to have a redemption by the time the end credits hit. Have everyone hate him at the beginning, and then slowly reveal small snips of his past that help everyone understand why Tyler is the way he is. â€œI also like the way the actor is portraying him,â€ Eddie tacks on, and that makes Buck extremely happy because he IS that actor. At that moment, Eddie turned his gaze onto Buck. Buck blinked twice before Eddie spoke, â€œBuck, you said this is one of your favorite movies, so do you know who plays Tyler?â€ And of course Eddie would ask that. OR Evan "Buck" Buckley is an actor who goes by the name Daniel Buckley, and his family doesn't know.

entry.title: one single glimpse of relief
entry.summary:
Author: greyspilot

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 58,739Chapters: 11/20Kudos: 141

Summary: "What if I never get better? What if I always feel like this?" Buck finally looks back up at him, vulnerability and compassion clear on his too-expressive face. "I don't know," he says honestly. "I don'tâ€¦" he shudders, gives a tiny shrug of his shoulders and tries again. "I don't have an answer for that, man. It's been seven months for me and I still feelâ€¦like this." "Like what?" Buck just shrugs again, then mumbles, "Not myself." And Eddie doesn't know what to say to that either, because this is the only version of Buck he's ever known.Or: Buck and Eddie meet at grief group.
